intro: Anacheilium cochleatum triandrum, commonly known as the three-stamen spiral orchid, is a rare and unique member of the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its intricate floral structure, featuring three stamens that spiral around the central column. The plant produces small, delicate flowers with a distinctive coloration pattern that varies from white to pale yellow. Native to specific regions in South America, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern.
